'''Copper boots''' are a variant of [[boots]] crafted from [[copper ingot]]s. They are the sixth-highest [[tier]] of boots, having the same armor points as [[Leather Boots|leather]] and [[golden boots]] but with higher durability.

== Obtaining ==

=== Mob loot ===
[[Zombie]]s, [[husk]]s, [[skeleton]]s, [[stray]]s, and [[bogged]] have a small chance to spawn [[Geared mobs|wearing armor]], which may include copper boots. There is a 8.5% chance (9.5% with [[Looting]] I, 10.5% with Looting II and 11.5% with Looting III) for the mob to drop the boots they're wearing upon death. The dropped boots are usually badly damaged, and may be [[enchanted]] with enchantment levels 5-19.

== Usage ==
When worn, copper boots provide {{armor|1}} [[armor points]].

=== Repairing ===
Two damaged pairs of copper boots can be combined through [[crafting]] or using the [[grindstone]]. The durability of the used copper boots are added together, plus an extra 5% durability. Both the crafting table and grindstone methods do not keep the enchantments of either boots.

==== Unit repair ====
{{Repairing
| head=1
| Damaged Copper Boots
| Damaged Copper Boots; Copper Ingot
| Copper Boots
| tail=1
|description=|showdescription=1}}

Copper boots can be repaired in an [[anvil]] by adding units of the [[tiers]]' repair material, with each repair material restoring 25% the boots' maximum durability, rounded down. Two copper boots of the same tier can also be combined in an anvil. Both methods preserve a copper boots' [[enchantment]]s.

=== Armor trimming ===
It is possible to upgrade armor with trims. This requires a [[smithing template]], a boots, and an ingot or crystal ([[iron ingot]], [[copper ingot]], [[gold ingot]], [[netherite ingot]], [[emerald]], [[redstone dust]], [[lapis lazuli]], [[amethyst shard]], [[nether quartz]], [[diamond]], or [[resin brick]]).

These trims have no effect on the gameplay or strength of the armor.
